articles.title: CEO of Song-Generating AI App Says People "Don't Enjoy" Making Music With Instruments
articles.summary: Mikey Shulman is the CEO of AI music generator company Suno AI. He thinks most people don't enjoy making music anymore. His company has been accused of training its AI on copyrighted recordings without permission by the Recording Industry Association of America. Some people on social media are appalled by his remarks.

articles.title: Malaysia's AI plans may be at risk from US policy shift
articles.author: The Star
articles.summary: The potential effects of restrictions on artificial intelligence (AI) chip exports from the United States remain uncertain, says the National AI Office (NAIO). Read full story at: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/article-news/details/the-potential-effects-of-regulations-on-artificial-intelligence-chips-exports-from-the-U.S. and p.s.

articles.title: lllustrious: The AI Model That Wants to Rule Anime Art Generation
articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: A new open-source AI model has changed how creators approach anime-style image generation and its impact goes far beyond pretty pictures. It has changed the way creators approach image generation in a number of ways. It's a new way of thinking about how to create an image.

articles.title: Fastest growing job sector is Ai
articles.summary: Linkedin looked at millions of jobs based on user information from 2022 to 2024. The top two jobs were artificial intelligence engineer and artificial intelligence consultant. After those is physical therapist, workforce development manager and travel advisor. The fastest growing jobs in 2025 revolve around the two letters Ai.

articles.title: Gemini 2.0 Advanced lands on mobile nearly a month after desktop
articles.author: Nathan Drescher
articles.summary: Gemini Advanced subscribers can access 2.0 Experimental Advanced on the Gemini app for both Android and iOS. It offers improved performance for complex tasks such as coding, math, and drafting detailed multistep instructions. It currently costs $19.99 a month. It's unclear when it will become the standard model for premium subscribers.

articles.title: Thread by @ilanbigio on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: ilan bigio is releasing a new function calling guide for Openai. It's 50% shorter and clearer, with new best practices, in-doc function generation and a fully-functional example w/ weather API. It also has some useful tips from software engineering.

articles.title: How To Avoid ChatGPT Dependency: Are We Over-Reliant On AI?
articles.author: Chris Westfall
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI-powered platform that helps job seekers and small business owners in their job search. It can help with writing résumés, cover letters and more. However, over-dependence on AI tools like ChatGPT can have negative consequences.

articles.title: Seremoni Launches AI-Powered High-Quality Seafood Harvesting
articles.author: Simon Mainwaring
articles.summary: Seremoni launched last year with a $7 million seed money round funded by Cantos. Seremoni delivers Michelin-star quality fish directly to local grocers and premier restaurants. The company uses AI-powered robotics to transform fish processing.

articles.title: Starmer's AI plans closer to Bluey than a blueprint for Britain
articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: The dream of AI is that humanity is able to create and harness a higher power of intelligence capable of solving all the many problems we cannot solve ourselves. The nightmare is that the solutions it finds will be worse than the problems.      .

articles.title: One of Google Gemini's first AI agents is like a personal butler for luxury cars
articles.author: Jay Bonggolto
articles.summary: Mercedes-Benz is one of the first car manufacturers to use Google Cloud's Automotive AI Agent. It will roll out in the upcoming Mercedes-Benz CLA. It's powered by Google's Gemini AI chatbot and syncs up with Google Maps to let drivers have natural conversations with their cars.

articles.title: Fact Check: FAKE Photo Shows Bernie Sanders In 'Deport Elon Musk' Shirt -- Grok AI Image
articles.summary: The image of Sen. Bernie Sanders wearing a T-shirt that reads, "Deport Elon Musk" was created using an AI program called Grok. TrueMedia.org found "substantial evidence of manipulation" in the image.    It is 96% likely to have been AI-generated.

articles.title: Get ready for more robots
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Realbotix showed off its AI-driven robots at CES this year. The company's robots can replicate any human face with 14+ moveable points to create multiple life-like expressions, and they can interact with people as well as talk to each other.

articles.title: Using ChatGPT is not bad for the environment
articles.author: Andy Masley
articles.summary: ChatGPT emits as much as 20,000 US households per day and uses as much water as 200 Olympic swimming pools' worth of water each day. Training an AI model emits 200 plane flights from New York to San Francisco per day. Each ChatGPT search emits 10 times more than a Google search.

articles.title: WhatsApp looks set to get an AI makeover soon – here's what could be coming
articles.author: Eric Hal Schwartz
articles.summary: WhatsApp is testing a new look that brings AI front and center to the messaging app. The new look is clearly aimed at encouraging users to play with Meta's many AI tools. The changes also affect the Communities tab, which no longer has its own space and will instead live within the Chats tab.

articles.title: ‘Will Smith eating spaghetti' is the first AI benchmark meme
articles.author: The Daily Dot
articles.summary: AI video generators have come a long way in their relatively short existence. Will Smith eating spaghetti is a common symbol of their progress.    for some reason or another, this is not the way to measure their progress for many people. for others, it is.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence comes down from the cloud as chips get smarter
articles.author: Qatar Tribune
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is moving from data centers to offices. It's not just a matter of data centers anymore, it's also about business models. It could be about technology and business. It might be about data centers. It may be about AI and business models as well.

articles.title: Moemate Starts Ecosystem Development with $Mates Launch of 6m+ Users on 14th January
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: Moemate embodies Chainwire's vision of a truly accessible AI agent ecosystem. Chainwire will launch Moemate on January 13th, 2025 in Wilmington, Delaware. TruthTerminal is the first widely recognized AI agent in the cryptocurrency space, and it's followed by the agent-tracking.

articles.title: How AI hype is increasingly reaching the world of crypto
articles.author: Rob Nelson
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) and blockchain are poised to merge into a powerful technological force, according to Armando Pantoja, futurist and founder at Quant Index. AI tokens are going to be a big driver of the narrative sometime between the middle of next year and late next year.

articles.title: New training technique opens the door to neural networks that require much less energy
articles.summary: New training technique opens the door to neural networks that require much less energy. AI applications like ChatGPT are based on artificial neural networks. Spiking neurons are less energy-intensive than standard artificial neurons. The times at which the spikes appear can be adjusted to improve the performance of the AI.

articles.title: 'Will Smith eating spaghetti' is the first AI benchmark meme
articles.author: Mariam Sharia
articles.summary: Will Smith eating spaghetti videos have become an AI benchmark. The original one went viral in March 2023 and the subsequent iterations improved significantly in movement, detail, and realism. The actor created a parody video of himself pretending to be an AI-generated rendering of himself eating spaghetti.

articles.title: Guest Perspective: The promise and pitfalls of letting AI plan your vacation
articles.author: Citybusiness Guest Perspective
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is becoming more popular in the field of travel planning. 41% of leisure travelers in the U.S. and Canada have used generative AI for trip inspiration or itinerary planning. 1 in 5 travelers have used AI to plan or assist with travel, a 40% increase from September 2023.

articles.title: Reynolds Partners with STELLA AI to Unveil a Powerful New AI Tool at NADA 2025
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: The cutting-edge artificial intelligence technology called Appointment AI enhances customer service with faster, personalized response times and reduces missed service opportunities. Reynolds is partner with Reynolds on App appointment AI.      Â   "We are thrilled to be partners with Reynolds"

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman: The new No. 1 ability you need to succeed—it's not raw intelligence
articles.author: Megan Sauer
articles.summary: In the age of artificial intelligence, being knowledgeable isn't as valuable as learning how to ask great questions. Curiosity, adaptability and mental agility are the three top skills young people need to land a job. AI could eventually take over most workplaces' administrative tasks, but it won't replace human intellect.

articles.title: PM Starmer sets out an ambitious plan to make the UK an AI superpower
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: Keir Starmer is set to unveil a 50-point plan to achieve the goal of turning the UK into a world leader in AI. This comes as the country is looking at creating a home-grown challenger to success stories like OpenAI's. Artificial Intelligence will drive incredible change in our country.

articles.title: Here are an LSU professor's AI trends to keep an eye on in 2025
articles.author: Dillon Lowe
articles.summary: 2024 was a big year for artificial intelligence, and 2025 promises to bring even more developments in the field. 72% of all companies and 99% of Fortune 500 companies currently use AI to some extent. 80% of retail executives report experimenting with AI applications with plans to fully implement them by the end of this year. There are six major language models, or LLMs, battling it out for market dominance. The industry has called on legislators to act on AI regulation.

articles.title: Neurala Announces 2024 Year in Review: A Year of Growth and Innovation
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Neurala's 2024 was a year defined by strong growth in revenue, new strategic partnerships, and technical and product innovation. The global AI in computer vision market is expected to grow to $95 billion by 2027. Neurala continues to lead the way thanks to its technology leadership and the ability to solve real-world challenges.

articles.title: OpenAI releases economic blueprint
articles.summary: Kate Rooney joins "Power Lunch" to talk about the AI race between the U.S. and China and the latest details on the latest developments in the AI field.    "Power lunch" airs at 11:30 a.m. ET.

articles.title: Reynolds Partners with STELLA AI to Unveil a Powerful New AI Tool at NADA 2025
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Appointment AI is the latest artificial intelligence (AI) tool to leverage Spark AI. It is a result of a partnership between Reynolds and STELLA AI, the leading provider of intelligent conversational AI technology designed specifically for the automotive industry. Appointment AI will be available in the Reynolds booth at NADA 2025.

articles.title: National security adviser says AI is 'single most dramatic development' in a long time in exit interview with Spectrum News
articles.author: Maddie Gannon
articles.summary: Jake Sullivan's comments came in an interview with Spectrum News on Monday, exactly one week before President Joe Biden and his team will hand over power to President-elect Donald Trump. In the interview, Sullivan also touched on the Middle East, the withdrawal from Afghanistan, communication with the incoming administration and more.

articles.title: AI May Enhance Cervical Cancer Detection: A Global Health Transformation
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: WHO has set a bold target to screen 70% of women aged 35 to 45 by 2030. Cervical cancer is highly preventable and treatable when detected early. AI-driven cervical cancer screening has the potential to transform global healthcare. Dr. Elena Martinez explains how AI is revolutionizing the way cervical cancer is diagnosed and treated.

articles.title: Moemate Starts Ecosystem Development with $Mates Launch of 6m+ Users on 14th January
articles.author: Chainwire
articles.summary: $Mates is launching on Solana on January 14th, with a community launch. Moemate is a platform where both technical and non-technical users can create and manage advanced AI agents without technical expertise. Since launching in October 2023, Moemate has achieved over 500,000 community-created AI agents.

articles.title: Sex, Lies, And Deepfakes: CES Panel Paints A Scary Portrait
articles.author: Chris Williams
articles.summary: CES panel discussed the problem of deepfakes and how to combat it. It's a problem that will only get worse and for which there are precious few solutions. There are detection and provenance solutions to the problem. For lawyers, judges, and juries, they have to accept that they can't assume that something is what it purports to be.

articles.title: Get ready for more robots
articles.author: Sarah Jackson
articles.summary: CES 2025 brought us cool, zany tech demos and lots of robots. The robots shown off highlight how companies are thinking about positioning the tech, including AI, in the home. Realbotix offers robots designed to look like humans in three options: a bust starting at $10,000, a modular robot for $150,000 and a full-body version for $175,000. Samsung's Ballie robot will be available to consumers in February.

articles.title: Get ready for more robots
articles.summary: CES 2025 brought us cool, zany tech demos and lots of robots. The robots shown off highlight how companies are thinking about positioning the tech, including AI, in the home. Realbotix offers robots designed to look like humans in three options: a bust starting at $10,000, a modular robot for $150,000 and a full-body version for $175,000. Samsung's Ballie robot will be available some time this year.

articles.title: LlamaV-o1 is the AI model that explains its thought process—here's why that matters
articles.summary: LlamaV-o1 is a new AI model that focuses on step-by-step reasoning rather than the final answer. It is 5 times faster than other AI models. It excels in fields like chart and diagram understanding, which is vital for financial analysis and decision-making. It also excels on VRC-bench.

articles.title: AI as a Bogus Business...
articles.author: Jim Lieb
articles.summary: Imitative AI is not a viable business model. It has no model of the world. It is reductionist thinking at its core. Before transistors there were only vacuum tubes (and analog) and before vacuum tubes there was only telephone wire. The Internet was developed thanks to government support and control.

articles.title: Here's Why Airship AI Holdings, Inc. (AISP) Is Skyrocketing
articles.author: Maleha Afzal
articles.summary: Airship AI Holdings, Inc. (AISP) is one of 24 AI-related companies that performed well in the fourth quarter of 2024. AISP's stock returned nearly 172% as of December 31, 2024. The company provides AI-driven solutions to customers in the law enforcement, defense, intelligence, and logistics industries.

articles.title: Top 10 fastest-growing jobs in the US, according to LinkedIn
articles.author: Taylor O'Bier
articles.summary: LinkedIn released its annual list of fastest-growing jobs in the United States. The list includes artificial intelligence consultant, event coordinator, outside sales representative, sustainability specialist, treasury manager, land agent and grants consultant. LinkedIn's research shows 64% of workers feel overwhelmed by the pace of changes in the workplace.

articles.title: 161 years ago a New Zealand sheep farmer predicted AI doom. It's baaaaaaaad, he warned (arstechnica.com) 4
articles.summary: 161 years ago a New Zealand sheep farmer predicted AI doom. He warned it's baaad and it's not going to be good for humans. It's not good for sheep farmers. It is bad for humans, too. It will be bad for farmers.

articles.title: Zuckerberg Announces Plans to Automate Facebook Coding Jobs With AI
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg wants to start automating coding jobs with AI this year. In the future, AI engineers will build the code in apps instead of people engineers. Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff said in December that the company would no longer hire software engineers in 2025.

articles.title: US eyes control over global AI chip distribution
articles.author: Karen Freifeld
articles.summary: The U.S. government will further restrict artificial intelligence chip and technology exports. The new regulations will cap the number of AI chips that can be exported to most countries and allow unlimited access to AI technology for America's closest allies. There will be a block on exports to China, Russia, Iran and North Korea. About 18 countries, including Japan, Britain, South Korea and the Netherlands will be exempt from the rules, while 120 other countries will face country caps.

articles.title: AGI versus 'broad, shallow intelligence'
articles.author: Gary Marcus
articles.summary: Nobody serious thinks that we have reached artificial general intelligence yet. Ben Goertzel, Shane Legg and Ernest Davis define AGI as any intelligence that is flexible and general, with resourcefulness and reliability comparable to (or beyond) human intelligence. LLMs don't meet that criteria.

articles.title: Will Artificial Intelligence Replace Us or Empower Us?
articles.author: Peter Coy
articles.summary: I took three Waymo rides this month while in San Francisco for an economics conference. Erik Brynjolfsson of Stanford was one of the busiest speakers at the conference. He talked about his hopes for a human-centric A.I. and his warnings about what he has called the 'Turing Trap'.

articles.title: AI Drives Global Data Center Demand
articles.author: Bf Staff
articles.summary: JLL predicts the data center industry will grow at a phenomenal pace in 2025. 10 GW is projected to break ground globally in 2025, while 7 GW will likely reach completion. AI will represent less than 50% of data center demand in 2030, with traditional, lower-intensity workloads like data storage and cloud-based applications comprising most of the demand.

articles.title: Cognizant Unveils Stores 360 To Revolutionize Retail Operations In Partnership With ServiceNow
articles.summary: Cognizant's Stores 360 is an advanced retail solution aimed at optimizing store operations, boosting employee efficiency, and enhancing customer experiences. It was developed in partnership with ServiceNow and integrates the Cognizant Neuro AI platform and the AI-driven Now Assist solution. It can be deployed within four weeks, reducing new store setup times by 10-20 percent, cutting operating expenses by 30-40 percent, achieving up to 98 percent system uptime, and decreasing truck rolls by up to 10%.

articles.title: Dearth of AI infrastructure constrains PH businesses
articles.author: The Philadelphia Inquirer
articles.summary: Local enterprises lack artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure, hindering their deployment of advanced technology needed to improve operations. The primary challenge remains infrastructure readiness, with gaps in compute, data center network performance and cybersecurity, amongst other areas.   Â

articles.title: Cybersecurity at AI speed: How agentic AI is supercharging SOC teams in 2025
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: Agentic AI helps SOCs automate decision-making and adapt to evolving threats, streamline workflows, and improve incident response. It also helps them to streamline their workflows and improve their response times. It's a powerful tool for SOCs.

articles.title: I Tried This New Chinese-Developed Super-Powerful AI Model
articles.author: John Awa-abuon
articles.summary: DeepSeek is a new AI chatbot developed by a Chinese tech company. Its flagship model, V3, uses a unique Mixture-of-Experts architecture. It's an open-source AI model, so anyone can explore, test and build on it for free. It performed well on creative writing, coding assistance and productivity-related tasks. It occasionally provided incorrect or incomplete information.

articles.title: Professor's lecture aims to demystify artificial intelligence
articles.author: Edie Schmierbach
articles.summary: 'Demystifying AI: What It Is and Why It Matters' is the topic for the next Free Press Knowledge and Lecture Series presentation at 6 p.m. Jan. 21 at the newspaper's building, 418 S. Second St. in Manhatten. The presenter is Rajeev Bukralia, a tenured associate professor and graduate faculty member in the computer information science department at Minnesota State University.

articles.title: Op-ed: In the race toward AI, don't leave New York small businesses behind
articles.author: Lilac Bar David
articles.summary: Small businesses are the backbone of New York's economy, accounting for 99.8% of all firms and employing 47.1% of the state's workers. Only 3.3% of small businesses in New York are integrating artificial intelligence into their daily operations. Most AI tools are designed with consumers or large enterprises in mind. Small businesses operate with limited resources and don't have the luxury of large IT departments to implement complex systems.

articles.title: AI poses greatest geopolitical threat to US: Jake Sullivan
articles.author: Christian Datoc
articles.summary: Jake Sullivan, President Joe Biden's national security adviser, said Monday that artificial intelligence poses the greatest threat to the U.S. national security for the incoming Trump administration. Biden is preparing to issue one final AI order later this week, which will solidify language surrounding the use of artificial intelligence in national defense.

articles.title: WhatsApp wants to bring Meta AI to your home screen
articles.author: Karandeep Singh Oberoi
articles.summary: WhatsApp is working on a dedicated Meta AI widget to make it easier for users to access the AI tool. The widget was spotted in WhatsApp beta 2.25.1.27. It will be limited to countries with access to the Meta AI tool and will be available on Android devices.

articles.title: Soon Keir will be replaced by a sad, automated voice. Will we know the difference?
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: ChatGPT has written a speech about AI and how it is reshaping our lives in profound ways. It is not just a tool for the future, it is already reshaping people's lives in significant ways. ChatGPT was asked to give a speech.

articles.title: UK Tech Minister Advocates AI for Children's Homework
articles.author: William Dove
articles.summary: Peter Kyle believes that children should be allowed to use AI technology such as ChatGPT when completing their homework. The technology allows users to generate whole essays with minimal prompts. Some universities have already taken steps to ban or minimise the use of AI technology, with some allowing it for spelling and grammar correction.

articles.title: Transforming Cloud Management: The Rise of Intelligent IT Operations
articles.author: International Business Times
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence for IT Operations (AIOps) has ushered in a new era of managing cloud environments. Sushil Prabhu Prabhakaran, a thought leader in cloud engineering, explains how these advancements are beneficial for IT operations.

articles.title: Navigating the New Era of AI Model Deployment
articles.author: International Business Times
articles.summary: Snehansh Devera Konda explores the challenges of operationalizing artificial intelligence and machine learning technology. She also explores innovations in strategies that can be transformative for the industry. She explains how AI and ML have revolutionized industries, but operationalizing them presents distinct challenges.

articles.title: Smart Innovations Driving Urban Mobility Transformation
articles.author: International Business Times
articles.summary: Venkata Krishna Reddy Kovvuri looks at the transformative potential of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and cloud computing in urban mobility and sustainability in the fast growing digital landscape. He examines how AI is driving significant advancements in urbanmobility and sustainability.

articles.title: Intelex Vision raises £5.6m Series A funding
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: Intelex Vision has successfully closed a £5.6m ($7.0m) Series A funding round backed by Acurio Ventures, Adara Ventures and Inveready, among others. It's a company specialising in AI-driven video analytics for real-time surveillance.

articles.title: Cybersecurity at AI speed: How agentic AI is supercharging SOC teams in 2025
articles.summary: Security operations centers (SOCs) are under siege by a new wave of automated adversarial attacks. Agentic AI helps SOCs automate decision-making, adapt to evolving threats and streamline workflows. It's proven effective at improving efficiency and strengthening security by identifying risks and reducing manual effort needed to track them.

articles.title: Arrested by AI: Police ignore standards after facial recognition matches
articles.author: Douglas Macmillan
articles.summary: At least eight people have been wrongfully arrested in the United States after being identified through facial recognition technology. Washington Post investigation found that law enforcement agencies across the nation are using the technology as a shortcut to finding and arresting suspects without other evidence. Most police departments are not required to report that they use facial recognition and few keep records of their use of the technology.

articles.title: Employers plan to downsize workforces due to AI
articles.summary: According to a survey by the World Economic Forum, 41% of firms plan to cut staffing using A.I. technology, and 41% plan to do it in the future. It is estimated that the technology will save billions of dollars.

articles.title: How is Schmidt Sciences supporting AI researchers?
articles.author: Paul Karon
articles.summary: Eric and Wendy Schmidt have been supporting AI research since before the formation of Schmidt Sciences. The program AI2050 is supported by a $125 million commitment over five years from the Schmidts. It provides a total of $12 million across the group of scholars to advance their research. It has now backed 71 researchers from seven countries and dozens of institutions.

articles.title: Exclusive: AG Bonta puts health care, other industries on notice on use of AI
articles.author: Chase Di Feliciantonio
articles.summary: California Attorney General Rob Bonta issued a warning to businesses using artificial intelligence on Monday. He wants them to heed existing protections around civil rights, data privacy and false advertising when deploying the still developing technology in the health care industry. AI is already in use by Sutter Health and Kaiser doctors in the Bay Area to help transcribe patient visit notes. The issue of AI's influence on health care has reached the federal level.

articles.title: This Is Not A Drill: The Newest Gen iPad Mini Is At An All-Time Low — And We Don't Think It'll Last
articles.author: Kevin Cortez
articles.summary: The latest iPad Mini is on sale on Amazon for $100 off. It's the first time the tablets have been on sale since their debut, dropping the price from $499 to $399. The iPad Mini 7 has an 8.3-inch screen and an A17 Pro chip. It also has a 12 MP camera, Touch ID for extra security measures and up to 10 hours of battery life.

articles.title: Generative AI chatbots like ChatGPT can act as an 'emotional sanctuary' for mental health
articles.author: Psy Post
articles.summary: Researchers conducted interviews with people who used chatbots such as ChatGPT for mental health support. Participants described their interactions with AI chatbots as life-changing and they said it supported them through their darkest times or helped them heal from trauma. The study was published in the journal npj Mental Health Research.

articles.title: Why Biden Is Rushing to Restrict AI Chip Exports
articles.author: Billy Perrigo
articles.summary: Biden Administration's move to curb exports on the advanced computer chips used to power artificial intelligence (AI) came in the wake of two major events that rattled the world of AI. OpenAI's latest AI model, o3, achieved an 88% on a set of difficult reasoning tests. Chinese company DeepSeek released an AI model that outperformed any American open-source language model, including Meta's Llama series. The achievement surprised many AI researchers and U.S. officials, who had believed China lagged behind in terms of AI capabilities.

articles.title: Mercedes-Benz's Virtual Assistant uses Google's conversational AI agent
articles.author: Umar Shakir
articles.summary: Google's new Automotive AI Agent promises to 'continue conversations and reference information' throughout users' drives. The first car with it is the new Mercedes CLA. It has the next-generation MBOS operating system with an upgraded MBUX Virtual Assistant. The existing MBUX Voice Assistant can handle about 20 commands triggered with 'Hey Mercedes' but it's not a conversational platform. Mercedes plans to roll out the upgraded system to further models.

articles.title: Advocates Urge Government to Prioritise AI Safety in Growth Agenda
articles.author: Evgenia Filimianova
articles.summary: The government has adopted all 50 recommendations from the AI Opportunities Action Plan. The plan includes a series of AI 'growth zones' around the UK to speed up AI development and provides support for building data centres and AI infrastructure. It also includes funding commitments to regulators to scale up their AI capabilities.

articles.title: Quantum Computing: An Existential Threat?
articles.author: The Grumpy Old Fart
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) grabs most of the headlines these days. Underneath the AI buzz lies a more serious threat: quantum computing. Quantum mechanics is difficult for even scientists to fully grasp, and its applications are obscure to the general public. Quantum computers could solve complex problems at speeds unimaginable by today's classical computers in a fraction of the time. They could also break encryption systems that protect our digital world.

articles.title: AI Could Help Us Predict the Northern Lights
articles.author: Luis Prada
articles.summary: Researchers from the University of New Hampshire developed an AI tool capable of sorting over 706 million images taken by NASA's THEMIS satellite between 2008 and 2022. The tool will help researchers to better understand and predict when the northern lights will occur and where they will be visible.

articles.title: AI tools can help reduce climate risks, State strategy says
articles.author: Edward Graham
articles.summary: The State Department's National Adaptation and Resilience Planning Strategy was released on Friday. It outlined the potential impacts of climate change on various industries and communities and the steps that can be taken to mitigate these risks. It said AI can be used to reduce uncertainty, hedge against uncertainty and prepare for the long-term effects of a warming planet.

articles.title: China promotes data labeling to spur AI development
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: China has recently unveiled a guideline aimed at nurturing its data-labeling industry. China wants to boost the development of artificial intelligence (AI). By 2027, China's data- labeling industry is expected to be worth $100 billion.

articles.title: Looking Ahead to the World Economic Forum in Davos (Workday Inc)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: In this article, we discuss how AI can help us focus on what truly matters: creativity, connection, and driving real impact. We also discuss why the AI revolution demands a new kind of leader who embraces human-centricity and collaboration and human-centeredness.

articles.title: The man who blew up a Cybertruck used ChatGPT. Should this raise concerns about artificial intelligence?
articles.author: Estelle Atkinson
articles.summary: ChatGPT asked a U.S. Army Master Sgt. Matthew Livelsberger questions about how to acquire and use explosive materials the day before he rented a Cybertruck in Denver and began his journey to Las Vegas, where he fatally shot himself in the head. Seven people were injured in the explosion.

articles.title: Microsoft's own baddie team 'attacked' more than 100 generative AI products: Here's what they learnt
articles.author: Efosa Udinmwen
articles.summary: Microsoft's AI'red team has been addressing the risks in artificial intelligence systems for the past seven years. It has released a whitepaper with its findings. It emphasizes the importance of combining human expertise with automation to detect and mitigate risks effectively. It also stressed the need for continuous testing, updated practices and 'break-fix' cycles.

articles.title: ConcertAI Presents at 43rd Annual J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference: 2024 Results and 2025-2028 AI Solutions Roadmap
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: ConcertAI is a leader in oncology predictive, generative, and agentic AI SaaS and Real-World Data (RWD) solutions for healthcare and life sciences. ConcertAI outlined its FY2024 business results, key partnerships, and future roadmap at the 43rd annual J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference.

articles.title: Top 8 PROS and CONS of Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: Tags
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has boomed over the past few years. Here are 8 pros and cons of this technological era we are all living in right now. AI can be helpful in research and writing, but it can also create fake news and critical errors. New vision language model LLaVA-o1 developed in China enhances reasoning abilities but struggles with complex tasks.

articles.title: Microsoft Unveils Core AI: A Bold Leap in Shaping the Future of AI Applications
articles.author: Muslim Farooque
articles.summary: Microsoft introduces Core AI Platform and Tools, a new engineering organization aimed at advancing its AI capabilities. The group's goal is to develop a comprehensive AI stack for first-party and third-party customers to create and run AI applications and agents. Jay Parikh takes charge as executive vice president.

articles.title: UK to fast-track data center approvals as part of AI action plan
articles.author: Igor Bonifacic
articles.summary: Keir Starmer's government announced a new AI Opportunities Action Plan on Monday. The first AI Growth Zone will be established in Culham, Oxfordshire, home to the country's Atomic Energy Authority. The government plans to increase state-owned compute capacity by a factor of 20 and build a new supercomputer with enough AI power to play chess half a million times a second. It also plans to establish a National Data Library and a National AI Energy Council.

articles.title: Microsoft creates new AI platform and tools division, led by former Facebook engineering chief Jay Parikh

articles.author: Kate Rooney

articles.title: Global data center demand surges despite supply and power constraints (Jones Lang LaSalle Inc)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: The data center industry plays a critical role in AI adoption and advancement. articles.title: How AI Revolution Is Driving 200,000 Layoffs On Wall Street

articles.summary: According to Bloomberg Intelligence survey, up to 200,000 jobs could be eliminated on Wall Street due to advances in artificial intelligence (AI) and automation. Citi reported that AI is likely to displace more jobs across the banking industry than in any other sector. Mark Zuckerberg believes AI could replace mid-level software engineers by 2025.

Alterya monitors more than $8 billion worth of monthly transactions across both crypto and fiat channels. articles.title: Google Joins the AI Shopping Revolution With Agent Tools for Retailers

articles.title: Nvidia partners with Illumina, IQVIA use generative AI to boost drug discovery
articles.summary: Nvidia has partnered with companies in the life sciences industry to use generative AI to improve drug discovery and genomics research. Illumina and IQVIA are using Nvidia technology. Nvidia is also working with the Mayo Clinic and the Arc Institute. AI instruments and robots will help address the $3 trillion of operations dedicated to supporting industry growth.

articles.title: OpenAI outlines proposals to bolster national security, drive economic growth
articles.author: Miranda Nazzaro
articles.summary: OpenAI released a 15-page economic blueprint on Monday. The company's CEO Sam Altman will convene a gathering in Washington, D.C. on Jan. 30 to preview the state of AI advancement and how it can drive economic growth. The event is part of the company's 'Innovating for America' initiative to engage with individual U.S. states.

articles.title: 2025 Predictions
articles.author: James Corbett
articles.summary: James Corbett makes sure-bet prediction for 2025: 2025 will be the Year of AI. It's customary for pundits and pontificators to make predictions for the coming year, but James Corbett is going to do something a little different: he's going to make one Sure-Bet prediction, one Maybe Possible prediction, and one It's Not Technically Impossible! prediction.

articles.title: AI Enhances Breast Cancer Detection: Study Shows 17.6% Higher Diagnosis Rate
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing breast cancer diagnosis. A study involving over 461,000 asymptomatic women aged 50 to 69 in Germany found that the AI-assisted group detected 6.7% more breast cancer cases than the one-on-one group.

articles.title: US tightens its grip on AI chip flows across the world
articles.author: Business Day
articles.summary: The US government wants to restrict artificial intelligence chip and technology exports to keep advanced computing power in the US and among its allies. The US leads in AI development and AI chip design now and it's critical that it keeps it that way.

articles.title: Mercedes readies car you can talk to with help from Google AI
articles.author: David Welch
articles.summary: Mercedes-Benz and Google are developing an artificial intelligence-based 'virtual assistant' in the new CLA coupe. It will be able to give directions and answer drivers' questions. It is designed to listen to the driver and use AI to offer suggestions even without a clear prompt.

articles.title: Will Labour's AI revolution make your life better or worse?
articles.author: Albert Toth
articles.summary: Labour wants to 'turbocharge' the use of AI in the UK. Prime Minister Keir Starmer says AI will drive 'incredible change' across the country. International Monetary Fund estimates that the plans could boost productivity by 1.5 percentage points, with gains worth up to £47 billion a year for the UK every year over the next decade. The government says the new AI drive will create 13,250 jobs in collaboration with private tech firms. Unite has serious concerns about AI-powered surveillance and discrimination by algorithm.

articles.title: Here's how Gemini Live might chat with you about YouTube videos.
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Android Authority got Google's AI chatbot talking using an early version of the Google app. It also found ways to interact with Gemini Live about uploaded files and PDFs. Google's chatbot can talk to Gemini Live using the Android Authority app and Gemini Live chatbot.

articles.title: The man who blew up a Cybertruck used ChatGPT. Should this raise concerns about artificial intelligence?
articles.author: Review Journal
articles.summary: Matthew Livelsberger asked ChatGPT questions about explosive materials the day before he rented a Cybertruck in Denver and began his journey to Las Vegas and asked questions about it on ChatG PT.    i.e. "What are explosive materials?"

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Improves Breast Cancer Diagnosis
articles.author: Victoria Forster
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) can improve breast cancer detection and reduce workload on physicians, according to a new study featuring over 461,000 women. The research published in the journal Nature Medicine looked at integrating an AI tool as part of a national screening program for women without symptoms of breast cancer in Germany. In total, 2,881 women were diagnosed with breast cancer.

articles.title: Cary wants residents to know when town is using AI to serve them

articles.summary: Cary Town Council will present a draft AI plan to the council at a future meeting. Councilwoman Lori Bush and Carissa Kohn-Johnson want the town to create policies for the use of artificial intelligence in its operations. They want to be open and transparent about how and when AI is being used.

articles.title: 20 People to Know in Accounting: Greg Cockerel
articles.author: Amy Higgs
articles.summary: Greg Cockerel is an accountant. He is a shareholder in Monroe Shine & Co. Inc. and has worked in accounting for 27 years. He loves and hates the long hours and stress of the tax season, but it's also the most rewarding time of the year for accountants.

articles.title: Author Post: The Rise of AI Agents—and the AI Whisperers
articles.author: Tim Houlne
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) agents are becoming more mainstream in today's business landscape. They assist industries with their ability to perform specialized tasks with minimal human oversight. They enhance operational efficiency by automating routine tasks and reducing the time required for data analysis. However, AI agents come with significant risks, such as bias, transparency, and ethical use. There is a pressing need to upskill frontline workers.

articles.title: The man who blew up a Cybertruck used ChatGPT. Should this raise concerns about artificial intelligence?
articles.author: Estelle Atkinson
articles.summary: ChatGPT was used by Matthew Livelsberger, who wanted to blow up a Tesla Cybertruck outside the Trump International Hotel on New Year's Day. He asked ChatGPT questions about how to acquire and use explosive materials the day before he rented the truck in Denver and began his journey to Las Vegas, where he fatally shot himself in the head. Experts are divided on whether the incident raises concerns about the safe use of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Can robots be our friends? Company sells human-like companion robots

articles.author: Alyana Aguja
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has been transforming industries in 2024. The more powerful the technology becomes, the more critical the questions about ethics, regulation and societal impact have become. This will set the stage for a new era of AI-driven change.  .

articles.author: archyde

articles.title: "But what we know for certain is that at some point in the early 21st century all of mankind was united in celebration. We marvelled at our own magnificence as we gave birth to AI" (bbc.co.uk) 14

The plan also aims to improve public services, with the prime minister writing to all of his ministers to ask them to incorporate more AI in their sectors.

It aims to increase the amount of AI computing power under public control 20-fold by 2030 and establish 'growth zones' for new infrastructure. Tech firms have committed £14bn towards projects in the plan, which the government claims will create 13,250 jobs. AI experts warn of the 'huge risks' of embedding AI in the public sector.

articles.title: Waystar unveils transformative generative AI innovation to help providers recover billions of dollars tied to 450 million annual denied claims

It will help providers recover a substantial portion of payments tied to more than 450 million annually denied claims. articles.author: Elizabeth Carr-Ellis
articles.summary: Keir Starmer announced the multibillion-pound AI Opportunities Action Plan today. It will see AI being used for everything from "spotting potholes to freeing up teachers to teach". Public data, including anonymised patient records from the NHS, will be made available to train AI models.

articles.title: Artist Transforms Natural Landscapes Into Living Paintings

articles.title: 5 ChatGPT Prompts To Never Work During Vacation Again

articles.author: Ken Colburn
articles.summary: The Copilot+ PC is Microsoft's current campaign for those using the Windows operating system. The PC is built around an NPU (Neural Processing Unit) that specializes in handling AI tasks. It takes the workload from the CPU and the GPU, making the system faster and more efficient. It also has longer battery life and instant-on capabilities so it acts more like a smartphone. It's only available on ARM-based computers.

articles.title: Imitative AI Is Not a Viable Business or Capitalism Is Not Rational
articles.author: angryea
articles.summary: Imitative AI is untested, unproven and not coming true. Businesses are turning away from imitative AI because the productivity gains are not present at a significant enough level to justify the cost. The companies producing these systems need something to convince Wall Street that the abnormal levels of growth they have sustained since the last dot.com bust can continue.

articles.title: Sunlight Solutions Unveils Innovative Updates: Streamlined UI, AI Enhancements, and Global Features

The update introduces a refined UI focused on enhancing usability and navigation. The solution now features an AI-powered assistant designed to support users in various tasks.

articles.author: David Prosser

MajorBoost developed similar tools to Superdial's technology and will use it to improve its own AI agents' performance. The company's revenues have recently broken through the $1 million annual run-rate mark and the CEO expects to be at $10 million by the end of the year.

articles.title: Don't Let Technology Be the Downfall of Your Organization

articles.summary: In the world's artificial intelligence era, organizations are increasingly using technology to streamline operations and save on efficiency. Don't let the draw of technology distract you from the value of your human workers. When it comes to leadership and management, relying solely on tech can hinder your organization's growth.

articles.summary: Tempus AI, Inc. announced select, preliminary, unaudited results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2024. Tempus AI is a technology company leading the adoption of AI to advance precision medicine and patient care and is based in Chicago.

articles.author: Ray Schultz
articles.summary: AI is already streamlining the writing and editing process, says John Micklethwait, editor in chief of Bloomberg. articles.title: UK's Starmer says Britain will go its own way on AI regulation
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Britain will go its own way on artificial intelligence regulation, Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Monday. Britain will test and understand AI before it is regulated to make sure it's proportionate and grounded, he said. "We are now in control of our regulatory regime so we will go our own way"

articles.title: Does your food log need AI help? A dietitian experiments with the latest tools

articles.title: OpenAI Courts Trump With Vision for ‘A.I. in America'
articles.summary: OpenAI released its economic blueprint for the development of artificial intelligence in the United States on Monday. Sam Altman, the chief executive of OpenAI, will begin a charm offensive with an event on Jan. 30 in Washington to discuss the future of A.I. development with lawmakers, economists and Trump administration officials.

articles.title: OpenAI outlines how the US could lead the global AI race
articles.author: Reed Albergotti
articles.summary: OpenAI has published a list of policy proposals on how US federal and state governments can catalyze the artificial intelligence industry and keep China from taking the lead. The 15-page document argues that the US should invest heavily in energy and other infrastructure to spur investment in American AI technology. It also calls for a closer relationship between leading AI companies and the US national security community. OpenAI is also targeting state governments around the country in a new initiative called Innovating for America.

articles.title: Explainer-How the new AI chip rule from the US will work
articles.author: Karen Freifeld
articles.summary: The U.S. government issues a new regulation to control access to U.s.-designed artificial intelligence chips and technology by other countries. The rule restricts the export of chips known as graphics processing units (GPUs), specialized processors originally created to accelerate graphics rendering. Companies like Amazon Web Services or Microsoft's Azure cloud unit are exempt from the caps.

articles.title: Federal Government Announces New Export Restrictions on AI Tech
articles.author: Emel Akan
articles.summary: The federal government issued a rule on Monday limiting the distribution of advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technology to foreign adversaries, including Russia and China. The rule focuses solely on the most advanced AI technologies. There will be no restrictions on chip sales to 20 key allies and partners, allowing them to purchase AI technology easily.

articles.title: Biden admin to announce AI rule to 'enhance' national security and economic might
articles.author: MICHELLE STODDART
articles.summary: The Biden administration is rolling out a new rule aimed at responsible use of artificial intelligence technology. The focus is on the frontier, the most advanced AI models and the largest compute clusters. Some industries would not be impacted because they are not crucial to national security, including supply chain activities and gaming chips. The comment period is 120 days long.

articles.title: OpenAI Emphasizes China Competition in Pitch to a New Washington

articles.title: OpenAI Courts Trump With Vision for ‘A.I. in America'

Altman will begin a charm offensive with an event on Jan. 30 in Washington, where he will discuss the future of artificial intelligence development with lawmakers, economists and Trump officials.

articles.title: OpenAI wooed Democrats with calls for AI regulation. Now it must charm Trump.
